section.title: Motivation
section.p: Finally, we reach the end of our journey to answering . We know we can make every (complex) matrix similar to one in triangular block form (). Each block in triangular block form is a scalar-triangular block that can be broken up into the sum of a scalar part and a nilpotent part. Using the patterns from and , we saw that can make a triangular block form matrix similar to something simpler by building a second transition matrix in block diagonal form out of blocks that would make the nilpotent part of each scalar-triangular block simpler. And simpler for a nilpotent matrix means triangular-block nilpotent form. Putting triangular-block nilpotent form back together with the scalar part of each block in triangular block form, we get something called Jordan normal form.
